Description: Fragment of shoulder of North Ionian black-figured pottery closed vessel; inside reserved; exterior: black bands with added red and white lines separating friezes; in shoulder frieze parts of two lions, facing apart, the one to left walking, that to right sejant; blob and incised rosettes as fill; trace of decoration of lower frieze preserved.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 109, pl. XXXIV, no. 320.3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.947)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.6007 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
